notesStmt.note: Shelomoh ben Yosef ben Ṣalaḥ, his inscription on folio 49r. G'aramah ibn Sa'alam, his inscription on folio 118v. Yosef ben Shelomoh Ṣalaḥowner, his name inscribed on 187r. Saliman ibn Yaḥyah, his name inscribed on 188v. Abraham ibn Yosef al-Aḥmar and Da'ud ibn Yosef al-Aḥmar, mentioned as owners in a record of sale, 18 Nisan 1920 (1609), folio 89r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Pentateuch in Sa'adia Gaon's translation.

collation.p: Quires of 10 leaves each, numbered with Hebrew letters both at the beginning and at the end of the quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script of the 14th to 15th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adolf Neubauer (b. 1832, d. 1907), Hebrew scholar born in Hungary: purchased by the British Museum from him on 06 October 1870: inscribed ([189v]).
